intro: Commelina texcocana, commonly known as the Mexican spiderwort, is a herbaceous perennial native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Commelinaceae family, which includes plants known for their striking floral displays. The plant features slender, upright stems with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. Its flowers are small, tri-lobed, and typically blue or purple in color, with three petals and three sepals. Commelina texcocana thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments in its native habitat.
